title: What to Do Right Now If You're in Your 50s Without a Retirement Plan
subtitle: Essential steps to take control of your financial future and build a retirement plan.
content:
What to Do Right Now If You're in Your 50s Without a Retirement Plan

I'm Tyler, a former financial advisor and portfolio manager. If any of this is helpful, check out my new podcast, Your Money Guide on the Side, by clicking the link in my bio.

1. Stop Feeling Sorry for Yourself

The median retirement account for people aged 50 to 55 in the US is just over $10,000. You're not alone in this situation.

2. Run the Numbers for Yourself

With 15 to 20 years left to work, your best asset isn’t just money; it’s momentum. Small increases in saving and investing now can make a massive difference down the road.

3. Define Your Goal

Retirement doesn’t have to mean never working again. Maybe it means part-time work, paid sabbaticals, or slow travel between new projects. It’s not too late, but the longer you wait to start, the fewer options you’ll have.

Conclusion

Start building a plan today that you can live with—literally.
